title: Lisa D. Kenna
added: On October 1, 2019, a [[Freedom of Information Act (United States)|Freedom of Information Act]] lawsuit was issued by [[American Oversight]], an American [[activist group]]   group, against the [[United States Department of State]].  Kenna was named, along with other officials, in connection to the [[Trumpâ€“Ukraine scandal]].  The lawsuit requested communications of various sorts between the named officials and lawyers [[Rudy Giuliani]], [[Victoria Toensing]], and [[Joseph diGenova]], along with communications regarding Ukraine officials and communications regarding [[Marie Yovanovitch]], who was the [[United States Ambassador to Ukraine|Ambassador to Ukraine]] until she was recalled early in May.<ref>{{cite court |litigants= American Oversight, v. U.S. Department of State |court= [[D.D.C.]] |url= https://www.courthousenews.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/Rudy-Giuliani.pdf |access-date= October 4th, 2019}}</ref>  In the same week, text messages from former Special Representative for [[Ukraine]], [[Kurt Volker]], were released in a joint statement by the [[United States House Permanent Select Committee on Intelligence|Intelligence]], [[United States House Committee on Foreign Affairs|Foreign Affairs]], and [[United States House Committee on Oversight and Reform|Oversight and Reform]] Committees.  In the statement was a conversation by acting Ambassador to Ukraine, [[William B. Taylor Jr.|Bill Taylor]], and [[United States Ambassador to the European Union|Ambassador to the European Union]], [[Gordon Sondland]], over withholding aid to Ukraine.  Sondland redirected Taylor to Kenna over concerns that Taylor held regarding the withholding.<ref>[https://www.cnn.com/2019/10/03/politics/chairs-on-volker/index.html READ: Text messages between US diplomats and Ukrainians released by House Democrats] - [[CNN]]</ref><ref>[https://abcnews.go.com/Politics/top-diplomat-ukraine-crazy-withhold-security-sasistance-political/story?id=66039011 'Crazy to withhold security assistance' to Ukraine for political campaign: Top US diplomat] - [[ABC News]]</ref>
